name: Administrative Regions feature types
definition: The Administrative Regions Foundation Theme defines the internal Administrative Units and Service Areas in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia.

concepts.name: Abstract Administrative Boundary
concepts.definition: A line of demarcation between administrative units.

concepts.name: Abstract Hierarchical Administrative Unit
concepts.definition: Abstract Feature Type that establishes a spatial hierarchy of administration units dividing areas where legislated jurisdictional governance rights are exercised.

concepts.name: Municipal Administrative Boundary
concepts.definition: A line of demarcation between Municipal Administrative Units.

concepts.name: Municipal Administrative Unit
concepts.definition: Spatial hierarchy of municipal administration units, governed by the Ministry of Municipal and Regional Affairs, that divide areas where legislated local governance rights are exercised.

concepts.name: Regional Administrative Boundary
concepts.definition: A line of demarcation between Regional Administrative Units.

concepts.name: Regional Administrative Unit
concepts.definition: Spatial hierarchy of regional administration units, governed by the Ministry of Interior, that divides areas where legislated regional governance rights are exercised.

concepts.name: Report
concepts.definition: A Report provides the ability to publish non-spatial information about or pertaining to any Foundation Theme Feature.

concepts.name: Service
concepts.definition: Administrative and social governmental services such as public administrations, schools and hospitals provided by Public Administrative Bodies.
